Individual financial consultants refer to all FC & up as of 1 January 2024, including those newly joined
as or newly promoted to FC & up during the period. All qualifiers must maintain the designations of

0
Upline managers refer to all UM & up as of 1 January 2024. However, all upline managers newly
joined or promoted from LA or FC during the Period are not eligible. All qualifiers must maintain the
designations of UM & up as of the date of award presentation / bonus payment.
0
Agency leaders refer to all RM & up as of 1 January 2024. However, all agency leaders newly joined
or promoted from BM or below during the Period are not eligible. All qualifiers must maintain the
designations of RM & up as of the date of award presentation / bonus payment.
0

2024. However, the agency production of newly joined or promoted RD & up during the Period are not
eligible. All qualifiers must maintain the designations of RD & up as of the date of award presentation /
bonus payment.

保 誠 保險 $
7.
Package Policies refer to PRUchoice Home, PRUchoice Home Landlord, PRUchoice Home Deluxe,
PRUchoice Home Decor, PRUchoice Furkid Care, PRUchoice Personal Accident, PRUchoice
Personal Accident Plus, PRUchoice Golfers, PRUchoice Maid (including Local Domestic
Short-term Helper Scheme) , PRUchoice Clinic, PRUchoice Travel, PRUchoice Travel Working
Holiday, PRUchoice Travel Overseas Study, PRUchoice Relocation Care, PRUchoice Hong Kong
Study Care, PRUchoice Motor, PRUchoice Healthcare, PRUchoice HealthCheck, PRUchoice BMX,
PRUchoice BOX, PRUchoice SOX, PRUchoice Card Protection Plus, PRUchoice China Protection,
PRUchoice Cruise Travel, PRUchoice Group Medical and Group Life (excluding tailor-made
schemes). For this purpose, Group Personal Accident and Group Travel are regarded as
non-package policies. The list will be updated when new products are launched.
8. GWP refers to
· Gross premium before the deduction of reinsurance premium, commission, promotion
discount and client discount (i.e., the two discounts shown on the debit note).
. Policy levy including but not limited to The Insurance Authority's insurance premium levy,
Motor Insurance Bureau (MIB) Surcharge and Employees' Compensation Insurance Levy
(ECIL) is excluded;
· Premium written/booked during the Contest Period regardless of the billing status;
. For policies with payment frequency other than yearly, premium will be annualized. Policy
on short period basis is however an exception.
9. The Company reserves the rights to claw back the awards should the qualified production be
terminated subsequently.
10. All travel allowance would be paid through commission accounts and are subject to tax.
11. Appeal should be made on or before 31 January or 31 July in the year the result is announced,
with valid reasons and supporting provided for review. Any late appeal or appeal without
reasons shall not be entertained.
12. Overseas Convention is the annual business meeting of the Company, aim at offering a platform
to elite consultants and leaders to share their marketing and management experience. The
invitation is not transferrable or exchanged for other substitutes under any circumstances.
13. If Prague Summit/ Osaka Convention / Fast Track Convention fails to take place (for any reason),
you will be rewarded by cash or equivalent values of rewards (Travel Allowance) after deducting
relevant cost (e.g. reservation fee on Hotel and Flight Ticket etc).
14. The Company reserves the final right against any dispute in the contest.
New Business
1. New Business refers to the new policies written and booked within the Contest Period.
2. Orphan and assigned policies will be not counted as New Business.
3. Renewal of existing or expiry policies with alteration and/or amendment to existing policies
and/or additional policies due to splitting of existing policies will not be counted as New Business.
4. Additional or refund premium of subsequent endorsements/alterations from New Business as
defined above which are issued during the Contest Period will be counted.
Prudential General Insurance Hong Kong Limited
GIEB Overseas Convention 2025

C. Rules & Regulations
General
1. All terms describing agency operations and designations (including but not limited to
registration, titles, and hierarchy structure) in this document refer to those of Prudential Hong
Kong Limited (PHKL).
2. All General Insurance and Group Medical insurance business mentioned in this document are
underwritten and managed by PGHK.
3. All Group Life business mentioned in this document are underwritten by PHKL and administered
by PGHK.
4. If a financial consultant has already been awarded for Prague Summit (no matter ticket award
or travel allowance award) with his/her GI & EB production, he/she shall not be qualified for
Osaka Convention with his/her GI & EB production. If a financial consultant has already been
awarded for Prague Summit or Osaka Convention (no matter ticket award or travel allowance
award) with his/her GI & EB production, he/she shall not be qualified for Fast Track Convention
with his/her GI & EB production
5. All FC & up as of 1st January 2024, including those newly joined as or newly promoted to FC &
up during the Contest Period, are eligible. All qualifiers must maintain the designations of FC
& up as of departure date of the conference.
6. Only business generated from the sales of General Insurance, Group Life and Group Medical will
be counted. Production of MPF will be excluded.
Prudential General Insurance Hong Kong Limited

PRUchoice Cruise Travel, PRUchoice Group Medical and Group Life (excluding tailor-made
schemes). For this purpose, Group Personal Accident and Group Travel are regarded as
non-package policies. The list will be updated when new products are launched.
8. GWP refers to
· Gross premium before the deduction of reinsurance premium, commission, promotion
discount and client discount (i.e., the two discounts shown on the debit note).
. Policy levy including but not limited to The Insurance Authority's insurance premium levy,
Motor Insurance Bureau (MIB) Surcharge and Employees' Compensation Insurance Levy
(ECIL) is excluded;
· Premium written/booked during the Contest Period regardless of the billing status;
. For policies with payment frequency other than yearly, premium will be annualized. Policy
on short period basis is however an exception.
9. The Company reserves the rights to claw back the awards should the qualified production be
terminated subsequently.
10. All travel allowance would be paid through commission accounts and are subject to tax.
11. Appeal should be made on or before 31 January or 31 July in the year the result is announced,
with valid reasons and supporting provided for review. Any late appeal or appeal without
reasons shall not be entertained.
12. Overseas Convention is the annual business meeting of the Company, aim at offering a platform
to elite consultants and leaders to share their marketing and management experience. The
invitation is not transferrable or exchanged for other substitutes under any circumstances.
13. If Prague Summit/ Osaka Convention / Fast Track Convention fails to take place (for any reason),
you will be rewarded by cash or equivalent values of rewards (Travel Allowance) after deducting
relevant cost (e.g. reservation fee on Hotel and Flight Ticket etc).
14. The Company reserves the final right against any dispute in the contest.
New Business
1. New Business refers to the new policies written and booked within the Contest Period.
2. Orphan and assigned policies will be not counted as New Business.
3. Renewal of existing or expiry policies with alteration and/or amendment to existing policies
and/or additional policies due to splitting of existing policies will not be counted as New Business.
4. Additional or refund premium of subsequent endorsements/alterations from New Business as
defined above which are issued during the Contest Period will be counted.

Package Policies refer to PRUchoice Home, PRUchoice Home Landlord, PRUchoice Home Deluxe,

Personal Accident Plus, PRUchoice Golfers, PRUchoice Maid (including Local Domestic
Short-term Helper Scheme) , PRUchoice Clinic, PRUchoice Travel, PRUchoice Travel Working
Holiday, PRUchoice Travel Overseas Study, PRUchoice Relocation Care, PRUchoice Hong Kong
Study Care, PRUchoice Motor, PRUchoice Healthcare, PRUchoice HealthCheck, PRUchoice BMX,
PRUchoice BOX, PRUchoice SOX, PRUchoice Card Protection Plus, PRUchoice China Protection,
PRUchoice Cruise Travel, PRUchoice Group Medical and Group Life (excluding tailor-made
schemes). For this purpose, Group Personal Accident and Group Travel are regarded as
non-package policies. The list will be updated when new products are launched.
8. GWP refers to
· Gross premium before the deduction of reinsurance premium, commission, promotion
discount and client discount (i.e., the two discounts shown on the debit note).
. Policy levy including but not limited to The Insurance Authority's insurance premium levy,
Motor Insurance Bureau (MIB) Surcharge and Employees' Compensation Insurance Levy
(ECIL) is excluded;
· Premium written/booked during the Contest Period regardless of the billing status;
. For policies with payment frequency other than yearly, premium will be annualized. Policy
on short period basis is however an exception.
9. The Company reserves the rights to claw back the awards should the qualified production be
terminated subsequently.
10. All travel allowance would be paid through commission accounts and are subject to tax.
11. Appeal should be made on or before 31 January or 31 July in the year the result is announced,
with valid reasons and supporting provided for review. Any late appeal or appeal without
reasons shall not be entertained.
12. Overseas Convention is the annual business meeting of the Company, aim at offering a platform
to elite consultants and leaders to share their marketing and management experience. The
invitation is not transferrable or exchanged for other substitutes under any circumstances.
13. If Prague Summit/ Osaka Convention / Fast Track Convention fails to take place (for any reason),
you will be rewarded by cash or equivalent values of rewards (Travel Allowance) after deducting
relevant cost (e.g. reservation fee on Hotel and Flight Ticket etc).
14. The Company reserves the final right against any dispute in the contest.
New Business
1. New Business refers to the new policies written and booked within the Contest Period.
2. Orphan and assigned policies will be not counted as New Business.
3. Renewal of existing or expiry policies with alteration and/or amendment to existing policies
and/or additional policies due to splitting of existing policies will not be counted as New Business.
4. Additional or refund premium of subsequent endorsements/alterations from New Business as
defined above which are issued during the Contest Period will be counted.

GIEB Overseas Convention 2025
Page 3 of 4GIEB - Agency Overseas Convention 2025
PRUDENTIAL
保 誠 保險 $
New Business Policy Count
1. New Business Policy Count refers to the number of new policies written and booked within the
Contest Period.
2. Endorsement of new policies, orphan and assigned policies will not be included in New Business
Policy Count.
3. Renewal of existing or expiry policies with alteration and/or amendment to existing policies
and/or additional policies due to splitting of existing policies will not be included as New Business
Policy Count.
4. If the same insured holds more than one policy with same product class and period of insurance,
it will be treated as one New Business Policy Count only.
Persistency
1. Persistency refers to the total number of confirmed cases divided by the total number of
renewable policies.
2. Non-renewable policies like short-term Travel Policies and Contractors' All Risks Policies are
excluded in counting Persistency.
3. Only those policies with expiry date from 31st December 2023 to 30th December 2024 will be
considered.
4. Only cases confirmed to be renewed with full underwriting information and booked into the
system within the Contest Period will be counted.
5. Orphan and assigned policies will be taken into account in the calculation of Persistency.
6. Those policies which are not invited for renewal by the Company will not be considered in the
calculation of Persistency.
7. Only a single case will be counted for a renewable policy in the calculation of Persistency,
regardless of the number of renewals split upon renewal.
Prudential General Insurance Hong Kong Limited
GIEB Overseas Convention 2025

comply with statutory or contractual requirements (including the purposes mentioned below), or even for security purpose. We may collect personal information
including, but not limited to, full name, address, contact details, contact details history, date of birth, gender, nationality, family members, beneficiaries, identity
card copy and details, travel document information, health/medical records, credit information, product history, claims history, biometric data including but
not limited to your voice pattern, fingerprint and facial images, your location information based on your device, financial and medical information ("Personal
Information") to provide you with the insurance or financial products or services. "Personal information" shall also include, but not be limited to, the personal
information relating to your beneficiaries (or any other person designated or entitled to receive any benefits under an insurance policy), dependents, authorised
representatives, company staff, and other individuals in relation to which you have provided personal information. If you provide personal information about
another person to us, you confirm that you are either their parent or guardian or you have obtained that person's consent to provide such personal information
for use and transfer by the Company for the purposes set out in this PICS. We may also collect Personal Information about you from third parties such as other
insurance companies, agents, credit reference/reporting agencies, vendors, financial institutions, fraud prevention agencies, government agencies, medical
personnel, courts or public record.
China Personal Information Protection Law (PIPL)
The PIPL Addendum supplements the Personal Information Collection Statement and applies to you if you are located in Mainland China. The PIPL Addendum is
available on our website at https://www.prudential.com.hk/en/china-personal-information-protection-law .
1. Purpose of Collection
We may use your Personal Information for the following purposes: (a) the administration of our products and services, including to provide any relevant services
as discussed with you prior to any purchase of a product or service; (b) to process your application; (c) to administer and process insurance policies, insurance
claims, medical, security and underwriting checks; (d) to process payment instructions; (e) to verify your eligibility for insurance, financial or wealth management
products and services; (f) to design and provide you with insurance, financial and related products and services; (g) to communicate with you; (h) to comply with
any regulatory or other legal requirements or other internal business requirements (whether imposed on us or any third parties in Section 2 below), including but
not limited to anti-money laundering and Know-Your-Client obligations; (i) to investigate and settle claims and detect and prevent fraud (whether or not relating
to the policy issued in respect of this application) and/or other illegal activity, or security or technical issues; (j) to carry out checks using agencies including credit
reference agencies, tracing companies or publicly available information; (k) to provide customer services; (I) to perform automated decision-making or profiling; (m)
to perform a policy review or needs analysis; (n) to conduct research and statistical analysis (including use of new technologies); (o) to administer lucky draws and
other contests; (p) to enable us to perform our obligations to you; (q) to keep your information on record and carry out other internal business administration;
(r) with your specific consent where required for direct marketing as explained in Section 3 below, personalise and tailor, customised promotions, messages and
suggestions to you; and (s) any other purpose directly relating to any of the above purposes. With your consent, we may also use your personal data to send you
marketing communications, as described in Section 3 below.
Some of the purposes above are necessary to allow us to perform our contractual obligations to you and to enable us to comply with applicable laws and
regulation. We may also use and share your Personal Information for the purposes described above to improve our products and services. Your Personal
Information will be stored either for as long as you (or your joint policyholder) are our customer, or longer if required by law or as is otherwise necessary.
LAPA/PRMMBD (06/24)

8. GWP refers to
· Gross premium before the deduction of reinsurance premium, commission, promotion
discount and client discount (i.e., the two discounts shown on the debit note).
. Policy levy including but not limited to The Insurance Authority's insurance premium levy,
Motor Insurance Bureau (MIB) Surcharge and Employees' Compensation Insurance Levy
(ECIL) is excluded;
· Premium written/booked during the Contest Period regardless of the billing status;
. For policies with payment frequency other than yearly, premium will be annualized. Policy
on short period basis is however an exception.
9. The Company reserves the rights to claw back the awards should the qualified production be
terminated subsequently.
10. All travel allowance would be paid through commission accounts and are subject to tax.
11. Appeal should be made on or before 31 January or 31 July in the year the result is announced,
with valid reasons and supporting provided for review. Any late appeal or appeal without
reasons shall not be entertained.
12. Overseas Convention is the annual business meeting of the Company, aim at offering a platform
to elite consultants and leaders to share their marketing and management experience. The
invitation is not transferrable or exchanged for other substitutes under any circumstances.
13. If Prague Summit/ Osaka Convention / Fast Track Convention fails to take place (for any reason),
you will be rewarded by cash or equivalent values of rewards (Travel Allowance) after deducting
relevant cost (e.g. reservation fee on Hotel and Flight Ticket etc).
14. The Company reserves the final right against any dispute in the contest.
New Business
1. New Business refers to the new policies written and booked within the Contest Period.
2. Orphan and assigned policies will be not counted as New Business.
3. Renewal of existing or expiry policies with alteration and/or amendment to existing policies
and/or additional policies due to splitting of existing policies will not be counted as New Business.
4. Additional or refund premium of subsequent endorsements/alterations from New Business as
defined above which are issued during the Contest Period will be counted.

C. Rules & Regulations
General
1. All terms describing agency operations and designations (including but not limited to
registration, titles, and hierarchy structure) in this document refer to those of Prudential Hong
Kong Limited (PHKL).
2. All General Insurance and Group Medical insurance business mentioned in this document are
underwritten and managed by PGHK.
3. All Group Life business mentioned in this document are underwritten by PHKL and administered
by PGHK.
4. If a financial consultant has already been awarded for Prague Summit (no matter ticket award
or travel allowance award) with his/her GI & EB production, he/she shall not be qualified for
Osaka Convention with his/her GI & EB production. If a financial consultant has already been
awarded for Prague Summit or Osaka Convention (no matter ticket award or travel allowance
award) with his/her GI & EB production, he/she shall not be qualified for Fast Track Convention
with his/her GI & EB production
5. All FC & up as of 1st January 2024, including those newly joined as or newly promoted to FC &
up during the Contest Period, are eligible. All qualifiers must maintain the designations of FC
& up as of departure date of the conference.
6. Only business generated from the sales of General Insurance, Group Life and Group Medical will
be counted. Production of MPF will be excluded.
